Thanks everyone for praising me for my tenacity, but it's far less impressive once you know the details:
- between 2001 and 2008, I had a permanent research-only position in pure mathâ€”so I was literally paid to focus on hard problems like that
- I quit this position in 2008 and

The lifecycle of a pure math theorem:
- 1997: my PhD advisor asks me to work on one of his conjectures
- 2000:  I solve the simplest case and dream of generalizing my approach
- 2003: after years of struggle, I come to the conclusion that my approach *cannot* generalize
- 2006:
